boat.full_description:
Retired from fishing in 1961, she was converted to a motor sailer and sold to David Hunt's father, John, in 1964. She underwent a major refit in 1985 including new topside planks and partial deck replacement. In 1999 she underwent more major work when the engine was removed and new stern and stem fitted. She had a new wheelhouse and suit of sails made and fitted by James Lawrence.

In 2012 she took part in the Queen's Jubilee Pageant in company with other Dunkirk Little Ships as reported in Classic Boat Magazine.
boat.name: Maid Marion

ownerships.note: Sold to John Orchard of Porthleven in 1935. After the Second World War, she was sold to Jack Siley, chairman of Falmouth Docks.
ownerships.text: Sold to John Orchard of Porthleven in

boat.short_description: Built in 1925, originally named 'Westward', she was re-named in 1935. During the Second World War she set out to assist in the Dunkirk evacuation, but was diverted to le Havre.
